description: Initiates device authorization by requesting a pair of verification codes from the authorization service.

parameters.name: clientId
parameters.description: The unique identifier string for the client that is registered with IAM Identity Center. This value should come from the persisted result of the  RegisterClient API operation.

parameters.name: clientSecret
parameters.description: A secret string that is generated for the client. This value should come from the persisted result of the  RegisterClient API operation.

parameters.name: startUrl
parameters.description: The URL for the Amazon Web Services access portal. For more information, see Using the Amazon Web Services access portal in the IAM Identity Center User Guide.

nested_items.name: deviceCode
nested_items.description: The short-lived code that is used by the device when polling for a session token.

nested_items.name: userCode
nested_items.description: A one-time user verification code. This is needed to authorize an in-use device.

nested_items.name: verificationUri
nested_items.description: The URI of the verification page that takes the userCode to authorize the device.

nested_items.name: verificationUriComplete
nested_items.description: An alternate URL that the client can use to automatically launch a browser. This process skips the manual step in which the user visits the verification page and enters their code.

nested_items.name: expiresIn
nested_items.description: Indicates the number of seconds in which the verification code will become invalid.

nested_items.name: interval
nested_items.description: Indicates the number of seconds the client must wait between attempts when polling for a session.
